Package: org.grails.datastore.mapping.query.api

[Java] Interface Criteria

  • Interface for the implementations that construct of criteria queries.

    Authors:
    Graeme Rocher
    Since:
    1.0

      • public Criteria allEq(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object> propertyValues)

        Apply an "equals" constraint to each property in the key set of a Map

        Parameters:
        propertyValues - a map from property names to values
        Returns:
        Criterion
        See Also:
        org.grails.datastore.mapping.query.Query.Conjunction

        Parameters:
        callable - The closure
        Returns:

      • public Criteria between(java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.Object start, java.lang.Object finish)

        Restricts the results by the given property value range (inclusive)

        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property name
        start - The start of the range
        finish - The end of the range
        Returns:
        The criteria

      • public Criteria cache(boolean shouldCache)

        Configures the second-level cache with the default usage of 'read-write' and the default include of 'all' if the passed argument is true { cache true }

        Parameters:
        shouldCache - True if the default cache configuration should be applied

      • public Criteria eq(java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.Object propertyValue)

        propertyValue - The property value
        Returns:
        The criteria

      • public Criteria eqAll(java.lang.String propertyName, groovy.lang.Closure<?> propertyValue)

        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property name
        propertyValue - A closure that is converted to a QueryableCriteria
        Returns:
        This criterion instance

      • public Criteria readOnly(boolean readOnly)

        Configures the hibernate readOnly property to avoid checking for changes on the objects if the passed argument is true { readOnly true }

        Parameters:
        readOnly - True to disable dirty checking
